void next_knot ()
 Move this cursor to the next knot point. If it is already at a knot, move to the next one. If it is in an interval between a and b, move to b. If it is at the end, it will move off of the trajectory.
 
RJ::Time time () const

Member Function Documentation

◆ advance()

void planning::Trajectory::Cursor::advance ( RJ::Seconds  seconds)

Advance this cursor (forwards only) by a particular increment, in seconds. Reverse advancing (negative arguments) not supported.

Operates in linear time with the number of knot points forward to jump (larger increments will mean longer runtime). If this steps to after the end of the trajectory, this cursor will not point to a value.

◆ seek()

void planning::Trajectory::Cursor::seek ( RJ::Time  time)

Set this cursor to an arbitrary point in time.

Operates in O(log n) average case with n points in the trajectory.

◆ time()

RJ::Time planning::Trajectory::Cursor::time ( ) const
inline
Returns
The current time associated with this cursor. Not guaranteed to be a valid time within the trajectory's bounds.

◆ time_next()

std::optional<RJ::Time> planning::Trajectory::Cursor::time_next ( ) const
inline
Returns
The time associated with the knot point immediately after this cursor, or nullopt if there is no such knot (this is the end).
